intro: Lophanthus tomentosus, commonly known as the woolly lophanthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and it is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
